intro: Solanum bidentatum, commonly known as the two-toothed nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 meter, featuring simple, alternate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Solanum bidentatum contains toxic alkaloids, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is part of the nightshade family, Solanaceae.
